acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 0-72 hours ErC50=0.066mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat dermal study reported the LC50 value of >4.06mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 3,700mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.6 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data in in vivo studies, though no evidence of mutagenicity observed in any of in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests and DNA repair tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of delayed ossification of cervical bones/sternums without teratogenic effects, and an increase in the number of dead embryos at parentally toxic doses observed in teratogenicity studies in rats and rabbits (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986, 1987)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In the available rabbit eye irritation tests, mild irritation was noted 1 hour after instillation with a score of 1.0. All effects were fully reversed within 24 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (blood system, liver, kidney, bone marrow)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, liver, kidney, bone marrow)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "decreased RBC/hemoglobin/hematocrit," "an increased platelet count," "hepatocellular swelling," "eosinophilic hepatocytes," "renal tubular degeneration/pigmentation," and "hypoplastic bone marrow" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
